verses.text: And Elijah the Tishbite, \add who was\add* of the inhabitants of Gilead, said unto Ahab, \add As\add* the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.
And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto him, saying,
Get thee hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that \add is\add* before Jordan.
And it shall be, \add that\add* thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
So he went and did according unto the word of the \sc Lord\sc*: for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that \add is\add* before Jordan.
And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.
And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land.
And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto him, saying,
Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which \add belongeth\add* to Zidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow woman there to sustain thee.

So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, the widow woman \add was\add* there gathering of sticks: and he called to her, and said, Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.
And as she was going to fetch \add it\add*, he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thine hand.

And she said, \add As\add* the \sc Lord\sc* thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but a handful of meal in a barrel, and a little oil in a cruse: and behold, I \add am\add* gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.
And Elijah said unto her, Fear not; go \add and\add* do as thou hast said: but make me thereof a little cake first, and bring \add it\add* unto me, and after make for thee and for thy son.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, The barrel of meal shall not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day \add that\add* the \sc Lord\sc* sendeth rain upon the earth.
And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, did eat \add many\add* days.
\add And\add* the barrel of meal wasted not, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, which he spake by Elijah.
And it came to pass after these things, \add that\add* the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him.
And she said unto Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembrance, and to slay my son?
And he said unto her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into a loft, where he abode, and laid him upon his own bed.
And he cried unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, O \sc Lord\sc* my God, hast thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slaying her son?
And he stretched himself upon the child three times, and cried unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, O \sc Lord\sc* my God, I pray thee, let this childâ€™s soul come into him again.
And the \sc Lord\sc* heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
And Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the chamber into the house, and delivered him unto his mother: and Elijah said, See, thy son liveth.
And the woman said to Elijah, Now \add by\add* this I know that thou \add art\add* a man of God, and \add that\add* the word of the \sc Lord\sc* in thy mouth \add is\add* truth.
